column5: Pockets and I launched the old coleman canoe from Tiffin ramp and fished most of the day. About dozen boat all around one spot. The perch were hungry. We used minnows, it was nonstop all day. We got 8 jumbos for the fry pan. The fishing from shore looked slow, but from 200' off shore if was good. The perch seemed to be just off bottom. About 2:00 the perch seemed to move up amd we got loads from about 6-8' down. Than by 5;00 they were on bottom again. Lots of boats came and left, eveyone seemed to be catchin. If weather is good we'll try again next weekend. CX
ah so that was u guys in the canoe  ya we were down there too. we were in an 18 foot red lund and were just entering the marina when u guys were leaving.
The weather was nice, no need for gloves. Hope we can get out nextweekend too. Pockets and i both have are real fishin' boats put to bed. The canoe was a last minute thing. CX
well ya had better luck than myself, although I was fishin from shore and got skunked. Thanks for the report
